questions.text: According to the Strasberg’s classification of bile leaks, leak from an aberrant right posterior sectoral duct comes under?

questions.text: A patient presented to the OPD with chronic abdominal pain. On USG, the patient was found to have multiple calculi in the gall bladder and a dilated CBD. What is the next appropriate investigation?

A victim of road traffic accident was brought into the casualty with shortness of breath and pain in the right upper part of his chest. Inspection revealed bruising over the right chest wall. His pulse was 90/ minute, BP 120/70 mm of Hg, spO2 95%. On palpation, there was associated tenderness in the area and a chest X-ray showed the following picture. Which of these is the first step of management in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Needle insertion in triangle of safety

options.label: B
options.text: Intercostal drain in triangle of safety

questions.correct_answer: C. Opiate analgesia and oxygen supplementation
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Opiate analgesia and oxygen supplementation

questions.text: Shown below is a popular sign that occurs in acute appendicitis. What is the name of this sign?

A patient presented to the emergency department with severe right upper quadrant pain. On evaluation, she was found to have cholecystitis. Laparoscopic cholecystectomy was performed for this patient and was discharged the next day. The patient presented on the 3rd day complaining of abdominal pain. On USG, a 5x5 cm fluid collection was seen in the subhepatic location. A pigtail was inserted and bile was drained. What is the next step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Laparotomy, peritoneal lavage and T-tube insertion

options.label: C
options.text: Imaging to confirm site of leak

questions.correct_answer: C. Imaging to confirm site of leak
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Imaging to confirm site of leak

questions.explanation: Ans. D) CA prostate: Textile factory workers

questions.explanation: Ans. B) I, II, III are correct

He also complains of greasy stools that stick to the pan. Which substance in stools can be measured to test for pancreatic function in this case?

questions.explanation: Ans. C) Beger’s procedure for pain relief

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding renal stones is not true? Triple phosphate stones are common in patients with PCKD. Stones can form in both acidic and alkaline urine. options.label: D
options.text: Statements are 2 and 4 are not true

questions.explanation: Ans. A) Only statement 1 is not true.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man presents with fatigue, frequent urination, and excessive thirst. During the physical examination, you inquire about his night time urination habits. He reports waking up at night to urinate multiple times, which disrupts his sleep. What is the minimum number of night time urination episodes that defines nocturia in a patient with urinary tract disease?

A 12-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department with sudden onset of severe right-sided scrotal pain and nausea for the past 4 hours. On examination, the scrotum is swollen, erythematous, and extremely tender. The pain worsens when the testis is elevated (negative Prehn’s sign). Doppler ultrasound confirms decreased blood flow to the affected testis. What will be the next step?

Which of the following statements regarding Fournier's gangrene is/are true? Fournier's gangrene is a necrotizing fasciitis that primarily affects the skin and fascia of perineum, scrotum and even penis The testis is usually spared due to its separate blood supply from the aorta. It affects teenage boys with anatomical defects like high investment of tunica vaginalis Early surgical debridement is the mainstay of treatment.
questions.correct_answer: B. Only statements 1, 2 and 4 are true.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Only statements 1, 2 and 4 are true

questions.text: A 42-year-old male is incidentally diagnosed with a mass during imaging for nonspecific abdominal pain. What is the most appropriate management for this condition?
All of these conditions will cause bilateral hydronephrosis except?
A 28-year-old patient presents with bilateral flank pain and hematuria. Urine shows few coffin lid shaped crystals. An imaging modality is done as shown. What is the modality and treatment?

A 12-year-old boy presents to the emergency department following a bicycle fall. He complains of severe pain in the perineal region and inability to pass urine since the injury. On examination, blood is noted at the urethral meatus, and a palpable urinary bladder is absent. What is the next appropriate step in management?

options.label: D
options.text: Wait for bladder to fill and perform supra-pubic cystostomy

questions.correct_answer: D. Wait for bladder to fill and perform supra-pubic cystostomy
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Wait for bladder to fill and perform supra-pubic cystostomy

questions.text: A 65-year-old male presents with difficulty urinating and elevated prostate-specific antigen (PSA) levels. A digital rectal examination reveals a hard, irregular prostate. Prostate biopsy confirms adenocarcinoma. The physician wants to determine the most accurate investigation for local staging of the cancer. What is the investigation of choice?

Which of the following statements about bladder exstrophy is incorrect? Bladder exstrophy is commonly associated with bifid clitoris in females. Bilateral inguinal hernia is frequently seen in patients with bladder exstrophy. Disjointed pubis is a characteristic feature of bladder exstrophy. Hypospadias is commonly associated with bladder exstrophy.

A 30-year-old patient presents with a solitary thyroid nodule noticed during a routine examination. The patient denies any history of radiation exposure or family history of thyroid disease. On physical examination, the nodule is palpable and firm, with no associated lymphadenopathy. To plan for further management, what is the first imaging modality the surgeon should recommend?

Which of the following statements about venous ulcers is incorrect? Venous ulcers are most commonly seen in the lower part of the leg, above the medial malleolus. Venous ulcers are caused due to ambulatory venous hypertension. Venous ulcers typically have punched-out edges. Active venous ulcers are classified as CEAP C6.
Identify the mismatched finding in breast examination:

options.label: A
options.text: Infiltration of dermal lymphatics: Peau d’orange

options.label: C
options.text: Infiltration of superficial veins by tumor: Mondor’s disease

options.label: D
options.text: Infiltration of Coopers ligament: Dimpling and puckering

questions.correct_answer: C. Infiltration of superficial veins by tumor: Mondor’s disease
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Infiltration of superficial veins by tumor: Mondor’s disease

questions.explanation: Ans. B) BCT in node negative patients

The neonate shows no signs of distress or respiratory compromise. Which of the following embryological structures is most likely defective in development?

Identify the incorrect statement about surgical hemorrhage:

options.label: A
options.text: Reactionary hemorrhage occurs 24-48 hours after surgery

options.label: B
options.text: Reactionary hemorrhage is responsible for post thyroidectomy airway obstruction

options.label: C
options.text: Secondary hemorrhage occurs 7-14 days after surgery

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: A. Reactionary hemorrhage occurs 24-48 hours after surgery
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Reactionary hemorrhage occurs 24-48 hours after surgery

questions.text: A 45-year-old male presents to the surgical outpatient department with complaints of aching pain, heaviness, and swelling in his lower limbs that worsens after prolonged standing. options.text: USG monitoring till size reaches 55 mm

questions.text: A woman presents with a breast tumor of size 6 x 3cm, with adherence to the pectoralis major and serratus anterior muscle. Only the dermis of the overlying skin is found to be involved in the form of dimpling. As her surgeon, what will you designate her T staging?

questions.explanation: Ans. A) Occurs due to gradual slowing of blood flow and desiccation of tissues
